abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Structural Adjustment Credit
            supports phase two of the Government's structural
            adjustment program for the period 1990-1992. The thrust of
            this phase is: (a) to consolidate progress in exchange rate,
            fiscal, and monetary policy; (b) to stimulate economic
            growth through appropriate trade and pricing policies, and
            land redistribution; (c) to rationalize the public
            investment program; (d) to improve the administrative
            capacity of the public sector through public enterprise and
            civil service reform; (e) to improve the functioning of the
            financial system; and (f) to manage the exernal debt burden
            with the view to freeing up resources for economic growth.
            The program will continue to focus on improved incentives
            for production of traded goods within a stable macroeconmic
            framework. It also includes a technical assistance component
            primarily geared to support institutional reform.
